Coding modifications:
	1. MainActivity:
		1) set parameters for calculating minhash values for each image
			size: number of minhash signatures/values, theoretically the more minhash signature/values we calculate, the closer the minhash similarity to the real Jaccard Similarity)
			      I did a test (results shown below)

			dict_size: here is the number of integers hashed from each image's RGB value, here since we set 0-255 RGB values be hashed to 10 buckets, so dict_Size = 10x10x10 = 1000

		2) Read info from images (test dataset)
			a) All images are saved in the "drawable" folder under "res" folder.
			b) "a3160402803.jpg" is the original image to be compared with all other images.
			c) a111111, a222222, a333333, a444444, a555555, a666666, a777777, a888888, a999999 are the modified images from a316402803 by using mobile app to change brightness from a316402803
			d) "a5042835581.jpg" is a complete different image (image of a different drug) "a3160402803.jpg"

		3) Hash the 3D RGB values to integers by using 10 buckets (0-255 to 10 buckets), and these integers are the "dictionary" elements, thus dict_size is set to 10x10x10=1000
			a) added the getPixels_Hash in the ImageData class
		
		4) Calculate minhash signatures/values of each image
		
		5) Calculate the minhash similarities to approximate the Jaccard similarities between each image to the "a3160402803.jpg".

		6) Calculate the real Jaccard similarities between each image to the "a3160402803.jpg"

		7) Average time duration for calculating the minhash similarity between each other images to the "a3160402803.jpg"
		
		8) Average time duration for calculating the real Jaccard similarity between each other images to the "a3160402803.jpg"


Comparison between size = 100 and size = 1000

Below is the running result 1: (size = 100, dict_size = number of buckets * number of buckets * number of buckets, number of buckets = 10)
